alert.note: Alert for Mountains Southwestern Shasta County to Western Colusa County; Northeast Foothills, Sacramento Valley; Northern Sacramento Valley; Shasta Lake Area, Northern Shasta County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 19 at 8:04PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...A strong shower will impact portions of central Shasta County through 845 PM PDT... At 802 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong shower near Redding, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 30 mph with torrential downpours. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy downpours may lead to ponding of water in urban areas. Locations impacted include... Redding, Shasta Dam, Palo Cedro, Shasta Lake, Central Valley Cdp, Keswick, Central Valley, Whiskeytown, Mountain Gate and Centerville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this strong shower and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Mountains Southwestern Shasta County to Western Colusa County; Northeast Foothills, Sacramento Valley; Northern Sacramento Valley; Shasta Lake Area, Northern Shasta County
